tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE public_transport_routes (
  route_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  route_name TEXT,
  start_location TEXT,
  end_location TEXT,
  distance_km DECIMAL
)

CREATE TABLE public_transportation_routes (
  route_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  route_name TEXT,
  starting_point TEXT,
  ending_point TEXT,
  distance_miles FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE transportation_schedule (
  schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  route_id INT REFERENCES public_transportation_routes(route_id),
  start_time TIME,
  end_time TIME,
  frequency_per_day INT
);

CREATE TABLE PublicTransportationRoutes (
  route_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  route_name VARCHAR(100),
  route_type VARCHAR(50),
  route_distance FLOAT,
  start_point VARCHAR(100),
  end_point VARCHAR(100)
)

CREATE TABLE TransportationSchedule (
  schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  route_id INT,
  day_of_week VARCHAR(20),
  departure_time TIME,
  arrival_time TIME,
  FOREIGN KEY (route_id) REFERENCES PublicTransportationRoutes(route_id)
)

CREATE TABLE TransitStations (
  station_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  station_name VARCHAR(100),
  station_location VARCHAR(100),
  platform_count INT,
  capacity INT
)

CREATE TABLE Schedules (
    schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    route_id INT NOT NULL,
    stop_id INT NOT NULL,
    departure_time TIME NOT NULL,
    arrival_time TIME NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE Stops (
  stop_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  stop_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  route_id INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (route_id) REFERENCES Routes(route_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Schedules (
  schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  route_id INT,
  stop_id INT,
  departure_time TIME NOT NULL,
  FOREIGN KEY (route_id) REFERENCES Routes(route_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (stop_id) REFERENCES Stops(stop_id)
);
